intro: Physaria parvula, commonly known as the small-flowered bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Physaria parvula typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
